pattern.name: project_generic
pattern.description: Project skill available across all modes in this repo

pattern.name: project_mode_specific
pattern.description: Project skill available only in a specific mode

pattern.name: global_generic
pattern.description: Global skill available across all workspaces

pattern.name: global_mode_specific
pattern.description: Global skill available only in a specific mode

default.rule: Default to keeping essential workflow instructions in SKILL.md.
Add additional files only when they materially improve navigation, reuse, or verification.

folder.name: references
folder.use_for: Optional deep dives (APIs, schemas, checklists, edge cases)
folder.rule: Link directly from SKILL.md; avoid multi-hop references.

folder.name: scripts
folder.use_for: Deterministic validation or automation (prefer execute-first workflows)
folder.rule: SKILL.md must state whether to execute the script or read it as reference.

linked_file_handling.rule: Do not assume linked file contents unless they have been explicitly read.
Prefer reading the minimum necessary linked file(s) for the current task.

path_conventions.rule: Use forward slashes in paths (e.g., references/guide.md) for cross-platform compatibility.

override_priority.note: When the same skill name exists in multiple locations, prefer the highest-precedence one.

skill_md_minimum_format.note: SKILL.md must start with YAML frontmatter including name and description.
skill_md_minimum_format.frontmatter_example: --- name: your-skill-name description: When to use this skill and what it does (include matching keywords) --- # When to use # When NOT to use # Inputs required # Workflow 1) ... 2) ... # Examples # Troubleshooting

recommended_skill_md_sections.section: When NOT to use this skill

name_constraints.rule: Lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only
Must match the directory name exactly
